如下是google 搜索“what will happen after personal bankruptcy”之后的推荐网站：https://twocents.lifehacker.com/what-really-happens-when-you-file-for-bankruptcy-1781919974
以及相关的破产后信用分降低带来的影响：https://twocents.lifehacker.com/all-the-ways-bad-credit-can-make-your-life-difficult-1740467353
其中：
You May Not Get the Job You Wanted
While an employer won’t check your credit score, they’re legally allowed to review your credit report with written approval. Your credit score and your credit report are different. If your credit history sucks, both of them will reflect that, but your score is a number and your report details your past.

However, this usually only matters if you’re applying for a job that requires financial skills (like a loan officer or a bank teller) or a government job. Also, some states regulate employers’ access to this information. Credit.com reports:

That might seem unfair given that bad credit can arise from medical bills, layoffs and other factors out of one’s control, however, there are several ways to rebuild your credit and some states have enacted laws that limit the use of credit information in the hiring process. That’s the case in California, Connecticut, Hawaii, Illinois, Maryland, Oregon and Washington, according to the National Conference of State Legislatures.
